Time zone differences: Participants in the campaign may be in different time zones, making it challenging to schedule meetings, calls, and events at a time that is convenient for everyone.
Cultural differences: Different cultures may have different attitudes towards cancer and fundraising, which could impact the success of the campaign.
Lack of resources: Organizing a global campaign requires funding, and there may not be enough resources to cover all the expenses associated with organizing the campaign.
Coordination challenges: Coordinating efforts between different teams and organizations in different countries can be challenging, especially if they are not used to working together.
Regulatory compliance: Regulations regarding fundraising vary by country, and it may be difficult to ensure compliance with all the relevant regulations.
